senses.de: To judge or decide the amount, value, quality, or importance of something
senses.ex: The company is being evaluated to determine its financial status.

Tips.title: Subjective Nature
Tips.description: Evaluating something can involve personal opinion, not just facts.
Tips.example: Critics evaluate movies based on personal taste as well as technique.

Tips.title: Objective Analysis
Tips.description: Sometimes 'evaluate' requires objective analysis, avoiding personal bias.
Tips.example: To evaluate a research paper, judges must focus on the evidence.

Tips.title: Process Involvement
Tips.description: Evaluation may be an ongoing process, not a one-time judgment.
Tips.example: Evaluating her progress, the teacher noted improvements each month.

senses.de: To calculate or solve a problem by using math
senses.ex: In mathematics, we often evaluate equations to find their solution.

Tips.title: Precision Required
Tips.description: When evaluating mathematically, answers need to be exact, not approximate.

Tips.title: Step-by-Step
Tips.description: Mathematical evaluation involves following steps in order, such as PEMDAS.
Tips.example: To evaluate the equation, start by simplifying inside the parentheses.

Tips.title: Symbol Interpretation
Tips.description: Understanding math symbols is crucial to properly evaluate expressions.
Tips.example: To evaluate 3^2, recognize '^' means to square the number.

Analyse.wordDefinition:
Analyse means to break down a complex idea or problem into smaller parts to understand it better. It helps to identify the different components of a topic so that it can be studied in more detail.

In simpler terms, analysing helps you to understand something, while evaluating helps you to decide whether it is good or bad.

Analyse is applicable in situations where you need to understand a concept or a problem deeply, e.g. in scientific research, historical analysis, or literary criticism.

Appraise.wordDefinition:
Both appraise and evaluate refer to the process of assessing something or someone, but there is a subtle difference between the two words.

Appraise typically means to assess the value or worth of something, often in the context of determining its market value or financial worth.

For example, a real estate agent might appraise the value of a house before it goes on the market, or a jeweler might appraise the worth of a diamond ring.

So, when you are talking about determining the value of something, appraise is the appropriate word to use. When you are talking about assessing the quality or performance of something, evaluate is the better choice.

Assess.wordDefinition:
Assess and evaluate both mean to judge or analyze something, but they are used in different ways.

Assess is used when you are trying to measure or estimate something. For example, you might assess someone's understanding of a topic by giving them a quiz or test.

You might also assess a patient's health by checking their vital signs.

Assess is more about measuring or estimating while evaluate is more about judging or determining value.

Estimate.wordDefinition:
Estimate means to make an educated guess or approximation about something, often based on limited information.

For example, if you estimate the cost of a new computer, you might look up the price of the components and make an educated guess about how much it will cost to build.

In general, estimates are useful when you don't have all the information you need to make a precise calculation or decision, while evaluations are useful when you need to assess the value or quality of something in order to make a decision.

Gauge.wordDefinition:
Gauge means to measure or determine something, typically a quantity. It involves using a tool or instrument to obtain a specific measurement or reading.

For example, if you were to gauge the temperature of a room, you would use a thermometer to determine the specific temperature reading.

Evaluate is used when you want to make a judgment based on a set of criteria, while gauge is used when you want to measure or determine a specific quantity.

Measure.wordDefinition:
Measure means to determine the size, quantity, or degree of something. This can include things like counting the number of people who attend an event, weighing ingredients for a recipe, or determining the length of a piece of fabric.

Measurement is best used in situations where a numerical or objective value is needed, such as in science, engineering, or construction.

Rate.wordDefinition:
Rate means to assign a numerical value or ranking to something based on a specific standard or scale.

To simplify it further, evaluate is like giving a comprehensive review or analysis of something while rate is like giving a score or grading based on predetermined criteria.

Rate is more suited when you need to provide a comparative ranking, such as in customer satisfaction surveys or product reviews where you need to assess based on a particular scale.

Review.wordDefinition:
Review generally means to go over something in order to provide an opinion or judgment about it.

Evaluate is used to analyze or assess something for a specific purpose or decision-making process, while review is used to provide an opinion or assessment on something, usually for the purpose of sharing it with others.

Scrutinize.wordDefinition:
Scrutinize means to examine or inspect something closely and carefully in order to identify any flaws, mistakes, or problems.

Evaluate is more about determining the overall merit or value of something, while scrutinize is more about identifying specific details or issues related to that thing.

Weigh.wordDefinition:
Weigh means to measure the weight or heaviness of an object. But it can also be used metaphorically to mean considering the different factors or perspectives on a topic to make a decision or form an opinion.

For example, a doctor might weigh the benefits and risks of a particular treatment before recommending it to a patient.

Evaluate is used to make a judgment based on specific criteria, while weigh is used to consider all factors before making a decision or forming an opinion.

quotes.Text: Truthfully, being pregnant is changing me as a person. Each day is part of this amazing journey that has completely shifted the focus of my life and made me reevaluate my personal and professional goals.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Holly Madison

quotes.Text: There are four ways, and only four ways, in which we have contact with the world. We are evaluated and classified by these four contacts: what we do, how we look, what we say, and how we say it.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.Text: It's important to drive consistently to evaluate changes that are made to the car. You need to be very accurate with your feedback and communicate as much information as possible.
quotes.Title: German Driver
quotes.Name: Nico Hulkenberg

quotes.Text: Obviously, you're being evaluated every single week, and you want to perform every single week. It's just going out there and doing everything possible to help the team win.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Glenn Gronkowski

quotes.Text: Let the future tell the truth, and evaluate each one according to his work and accomplishments. The present is theirs; the future, for which I have really worked, is mine.
quotes.Title: Inventor
quotes.Name: Nikola Tesla

quotes.Text: Ideas are things that happen at any time because you're constantly thinking and evaluating life as if it were an eternally unsolvable math problem, which it is.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Greg Gutfeld

quotes.Text: I've had the luxury of playing golf around the world, and I've spent a lot of time evaluating how to play all kinds of courses.
quotes.Title: American Golfer
quotes.Name: Tiger Woods

quotes.Text: I've been evaluating how much I value happiness in my life. To be too driven takes away your happiness.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Heather Graham

quotes.Text: After ten albums, I can reevaluate my life. Maybe then I'll settle down.
quotes.Title: Swedish Musician
quotes.Name: Yung Lean

quotes.Text: Take a step back, evaluate what is important, and enjoy life.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Teri Garr
